meanings.sent1: The meeting was full of platitudinarians who kept repeating the same cliches.
meanings.sent2: She was known as the office platitudinarian for always saying 'teamwork makes the dream work.'
meanings.sent3: The platitudinarians at the party made everyone roll their eyes with their predictable remarks.
meanings.sent4: His speech was like a gathering of platitudinarians, each one echoing the other's empty words.
meanings.sent5: The group of platitudinarians seemed to have a competition on who could say the most overused phrases.

meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or characteristic of platitudes.
meanings.sent1: Her speech was so platitudinarian that it failed to inspire anyone.
meanings.sent2: The book was filled with platitudinarian phrases that lacked originality.
meanings.sent3: The platitudinarian advice he gave was so common that it was almost comical.
meanings.sent4: The politician's promises sounded platitudinarian, lacking any real substance.
meanings.sent5: The movie's dialogue was disappointingly platitudinarian, offering nothing new to the audience.
